snippet: Those who want to stay in small northern communities worry they could face more waiting as memories fade and focus turns to the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.
abstract: Japan is rebuilding from 2011 tsunami that swept away nearly the entire fishing community of Otsuchi, where 1,284 people died, including the mayor and many town hall employees, firefighters and police officers; in all, 18,490 people were left dead or missing and almost 250,000 people lost their homes.
lead_paragraph: Those who want to stay in small northern communities worry they could face more waiting as memories fade and focus turns to the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

headline.main: Japanese Coastal Town Still Struggling to Rebuild From 2011 Tsunami
headline.print_headline: A Struggle to Recover as Vast as the Ocean
